properties.name: A Harbourview Retreat Bed and Breakfast (Seymour Room)
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer#4675 - West 4th Avenue, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, V6R 1R6Experience... an oasis in the heart of the city. Whether you\'re traveling for work or pleasure, make yourself at home at our premier Vancouver Bed and Breakfast. Built in 1912 and renovated in 1998, the Crosby\'s airy Arts and Crafts-style home is nestled in one of Vancouver\'s most exclusive neighbourhoods. Explore the lush gardens or sip a cold drink on your private deck as the sun sets across the bay. Then enjoy the best night\'s sleep west of the Rockies. Guaranteed.

properties.name: Ausurfer lives here
properties.description: Posted by AusurferMollison street, West End, Qld 4101This is where I live. West End is a picture of diversity in action.

properties.name: Lion & the Rose Bed & Breakfast
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer1810 N.E. 15th Avenue, portland, oregon, 97212This majestic 1906 Queen Anne mansion, listed on the National Register of Historic Places, transports you to another time. The six guest rooms (all with private baths) are each unique and emanate Victorian charm. Historic yet up to date, the rooms are air conditioned and equipped with telephones, cable TV, and high-speed wireless internet access. The parlors and dining room are comfortable, spacious, and decorated in period furnishings.

properties.name: Lions Paw Inn
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer 3310 Pacific Way, Seaview, WA, 98644Built in 1911 as a large family home, this Craftsman style bungalow served the Long Beach Peninsula as a much needed hospital from 1930 into the 1940âs. The healing spirit still lingers in Seaview at the Lionâs Paw Inn. Stroll to the Pacific Ocean.

properties.name: Portland International Airport - PDX
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer7000 Northeast Airport Way, Portland, OR, 97218Portland International Airport is a bright and user-friendly airport located about 30 minutes from downtown Portland, Ore. Or, you can take the convenient MAX light rail service that connects the airport to downtown Portland in approximately 38 minutes. The light rail station is located outside the southern end of the terminal near concourses A and B and currently costs less than . Fifteen major airlines service the airport with Alaska Airlines and its affiliated Horizon Air offering the most flights. You can fly nonstop to over 50 destinations including Northwestâs recently added flight to Tokyo, Japan. The airportâs modern terminal facility is roughly shaped like an âHâ with ticketing (upper level) and baggage claim (lower level) in the center and five in-line concourses forming the legs. Also in the center is the noteworthy Oregon Market, which has better-than-usual shopping and eating options. Thereâs no sales tax in Oregon so go ahead and treat yourself to a Northwestern trinket.

properties.name: Powell's City of Books (Burnside)
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer1005 W Burnside, Portland, OR 97209Powell\'s City of Books is a book lover\'s paradise, the largest used and new bookstore in the world. Located in downtown Portland, Oregon and occupying an entire city block, the City stocks more than a million new and used books. Nine color coded rooms house over 3,500 different sections, offering something for every interest, including an incredible selection of out-of-print and hard-to-find titles. Each month, the Basil Hallward Art Gallery (located upstairs in the Pearl Room) hosts a new exhibit, as well as dozens of author events featuring acclaimed writers, artists, and thinkers such as Roddy Doyle, Susan Sontag, Robert Olen Butler, Annie Leibovitz, and former President Jimmy Carter.

properties.name: The Gaslight Inn
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer 1727 15th Avenue, seattle, wa, 98122Welcome to Gaslight Inn, a Seattle four-square guesthouse built in 1906. In restoring Gaslight Inn, we have brought out the home\'s original turn-of-the-century ambiance and warmth, while keeping in mind the additional conveniences and contemporary style needed by today\'s travelers. Through the late spring and summer, we encourage you to relax and unwind at poolside with a glass of wine after a long, busy day. Our private, in-ground, heated pool with several decks and interesting plant arrangements, is found at the back of the inn. The interior is appointed in exacting detail, with strikingly rich, dark colors, oak paneling, and an enormous entryway and staircase. Decorated with a tasteful blend of Northwest Indian Art, quality antiques and contemporary furnishings.

properties.name: The Inn at Otter Crest
properties.description: Posted by Ausurfer Otter Rock, OR 97369Whatever your vacation or meeting pleasure may be, you\'ll find it at The Inn at Otter Crest. We offer unmatched panoramic views of the pacific coastline, condominium style accommodations, full service meeting facilities, ocean view dining, whale watching, and an endless array of nearby recreation and scenic attractions. Escape to the tranquil and dramatic, Join us at The Inn at Otter Crest.
